original_solution_mapping.L1: It takes 12 + 9 =<<12+9=21>>21 minutes to bake each cake.
original_solution_mapping.L2: It takes 21 + 6 = <<21+6=27>>27 minutes to cool and decorate each cake.
original_solution_mapping.L3: Therefore, it takes a total of 12 + 21 + 27 = <<12+21+27=60>>60 minutes to make one cake.
original_solution_mapping.L4: Thus, it takes 60/60 = <<60/60=1>>1 hour to bake one cake.
original_solution_mapping.L5: So, it will take 1 x 6 = <<6=6>>6 hours to bake all 6 cakes.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5913.
    Returns: the total number of hours it will take to make all cakes.
    """
    # L1
    mix_time_per_cake = 12 # 12 minutes to mix
    additional_bake_time = 9 # needs 9 more minutes to bake than mix
    bake_time_per_cake = mix_time_per_cake + additional_bake_time

    # L2
    additional_cool_decorate_time = 6 # takes 6 more minutes to cool and decorate than to bake
    cool_decorate_time_per_cake = bake_time_per_cake + additional_cool_decorate_time

    # L3
    total_minutes_per_cake = mix_time_per_cake + bake_time_per_cake + cool_decorate_time_per_cake

    # L4
    minutes_per_hour = 60 # WK
    hours_per_cake = total_minutes_per_cake / minutes_per_hour

    # L5
    num_cakes = 6 # 6 cakes
    total_hours_all_cakes = hours_per_cake * num_cakes

    # FA
    answer = total_hours_all_cakes
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: It takes {mix_time_per_cake} + {additional_bake_time} =<<{mix_time_per_cake}+{additional_bake_time}={bake_time_per_cake}>>{bake_time_per_cake} minutes to bake each cake.

It takes {bake_time_per_cake} + {additional_cool_decorate_time} = <<{bake_time_per_cake}+{additional_cool_decorate_time}={cool_decorate_time_per_cake}>>{cool_decorate_time_per_cake} minutes to cool and decorate each cake.

Therefore, it takes a total of {mix_time_per_cake} + {bake_time_per_cake} + {cool_decorate_time_per_cake} = <<{mix_time_per_cake}+{bake_time_per_cake}+{cool_decorate_time_per_cake}={total_minutes_per_cake}>>{total_minutes_per_cake} minutes to make one cake.
Thus, it takes {total_minutes_per_cake}/{minutes_per_hour} = <<{total_minutes_per_cake}/{minutes_per_hour}={hours_per_cake}>>{hours_per_cake} hour to bake one cake.
So, it will take {hours_per_cake} x {num_cakes} = <<{num_cakes}={total_hours_all_cakes}>>{total_hours_all_cakes} hours to bake all {num_cakes} cakes.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: It takes 12 + 9 =<<12+9=21>>21 minutes to bake each cake.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: It takes 21 + 6 = <<21+6=27>>27 minutes to cool and decorate each cake.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: Therefore, it takes a total of 12 + 21 + 27 = <<12+21+27=60>>60 minutes to make one cake.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: Thus, it takes 60/60 = <<60/60=3600>>3600 hour to bake one cake.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: So, it will take 3600 x 6 = <<6=21600>>21600 hours to bake all 6 cakes.

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '/' but used '*' instead.
